channel.title: Compiler - JDK
channel.description:
[size=12pt]Hello pplz.[/size] I will keep this short and simple so it's easy and fast, please, POST IF YOU KNOW WHAT'S WRONG. Okay, about 2 year's ago, I installed JDK and set the classpath's and everything worked, including me being able to compile. My computer started acting up, and EVERYTHING on it was deleted. The other day, I downloaded JDK 6u7 and following the TuT "how to make a server" I set my classpath's. Now, of course, it does not work, only when I compile. I can still run a server though. This is what I get when I try to compile:
'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
OR...
You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0 or any JDK 5.0 and 6.0 updates. Go to Mod Taharok's tutorial on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for step-by-step instructions to download the newest JDK Update. Press any key to continue . . .
Of course I have the JDK installed and classpath's are set... These are my classpath's: [b]Classpath:[/b] CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%; [b]Path:[/b] C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin; ^ I deleted JDK 6u7 and now have 6u6 installed, but it still does not work. ^ Please, if you have ANY idea of how I would get my compiler working again, it would be [u]REALLY APPRECIATED![/u]

item.title: Compiler - JDK
item.dc:creator: @i_f00t0n_i i f00t0n i
item.description:
@i_f00t0n_i wrote:

[size=12pt]Hello pplz.[/size]

I will keep this short and simple so it’s easy and fast, please, POST IF YOU KNOW WHAT’S WRONG.

Okay, about 2 year’s ago, I installed JDK and set the classpath’s and everything worked, including me being able to compile.
My computer started acting up, and EVERYTHING on it was deleted.
The other day, I downloaded JDK 6u7 and following the TuT “how to make a server” I set my classpath’s.
Now, of course, it does not work, only when I compile. I can still run a server though. This is what I get when I try to compile:

'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .

OR…

You do not have JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0 or any JDK 5.0 and 6.0 updates. Go to Mod Taharok's tutorial on the Moparscape Tuturoials section for step-by-step instructions to download the newest JDK Update. Press any key to continue . . .

Of course I have the JDK installed and classpath’s are set…
These are my classpath’s:

Classpath: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
Path: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

^ I deleted JDK 6u7 and now have 6u6 installed, but it still does not work. ^

Please, if you have ANY idea of how I would get my compiler working again, it would be REALLY APPRECIATED!

Read full topic
